metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000077 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: RubyGems version Ruby 2.2 series: 2.2.9 and earlier, Ruby 2.3 series: 2.3.6 and earlier, Ruby 2.4 series: 2.4.3 and earlier, Ruby 2.5 series: 2.5.0 and earlier, prior to trunk revision 62422 contains a Improper Input Validation vulnerability in ruby gems specification homepage attribute that can result in a malicious gem could set an invalid homepage URL. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 2.7.6. It was discovered that the RubyGems embedded in JRuby failed to validate the a gem's homepage URL. As a result, a malicious gem could set an invalid or malicious homepage URL.

notes.note: tyhicks> ruby{1.9.1,2.0,2.3} and jruby ship an embedded rubygems.

criterions.comment: jruby package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.17.0-3').
